title: Aleksandr Gryunberg-Tsvetinovich
text: Aleksandr Gryunberg-Tsvetinovich (Russian: Алекса́ндр Лео́нович Грю́нберг-Цветино́вич; 1 March 1930, Leningrad — 3 March 1995, Saint Petersburg) was a Russian philologist specializing in <a href="Indo-Iranian%20languages">Indo-Iranian languages</a> and especially the languages of <a href="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>. He studied at the then Leningrad State University Iranian philology. His main fields of study were the grammatic descriptions of living Iranian languages, publication of texts, dictionaries and translations <a href="http%3A//www.alumni-spbu.ru/man.asp%3FUID%3D4003"></a>. Aleksandr Gryunberg-Tsvetinovich was the author of around 100 scientific publications.
